title: One feel-good/clarity thing that'd be really great for Tahm Kench's MinionDevour.
body: When you use Tahm's W to eat a minion, there aren't any indicators for how far you spit the minion, how big the projectile hitbox is or how big the impact splash-radius is. Riot, if you're doing any follow-up on him, that'd be a stellar improvement for clarity!

replies.body: Huh, good point, not sure how we missed that. We'll add that in.
Also, as a small change, when he devourers a Teemo can he instantly swallow him whole? I'm sure that 90% of League would support this change.
i remember them saying that tahm has specific taste and basically all the champs in the game taste bad to him in different ways so he just spits them out after they die in his mouth

this is a lot like the fizz shark interaction, it swallows yordles

agreed + support

Teemo has to be de-toxified before swallowing. So it really makes less sense on him than most other champs.

But in principle, I agree.
I think he should be able to, but then he takes poison damage and is blinded as well...

I just wanted to reply to give you some information on a bug that I have encountered with him. About 60% of the time if I eat a minion and spit it out immediately, the previously eaten minion will stay alive with a sliver of health and be attacked by other minions or towers but will not die for a few seconds.
Happend to me also with a champion. The bug accour.. you cant kill them because you deal no dmg with auto attacks... Also had a bug where i was unable to use w only until i used q again.
Hey, just wanted to check if this is canceled or still something you plan to do?
Next up, Kennen W range indicator!
Don't forget that when W is used to spit a minion into something, the splash is HUGE (+1 stack as well), and can easily hit targets hiding behind.

As an aside, does the damage on his W ripple outwards? It doesn't seem to damage everyone simultaneously (at least, I've attempted to juke it, seen it hit a minion, go back forward and then take damage). If intentional - the damage visual effects could be substantially improved to actually show the slow-expanding damage area. If unintentional - fix please.

Meddler I have a question on relic shield. Is there a reason why the range is based of the minion death. When I was using {{champion:223}} and would spit a minion and it would die, but my adc wouldn't get gold because I spit the minion out of range, but if it were champion they would have got it. Is there a reason it is coded this way?

My best guess would be to disallow hyper-long range minion farming and giving the gold from across the map (Like GP support ulting a pushing top lane and sharing minion gold to your ADC in bot lane. Same goes for an Ezreal picking it up in base, ulting, and selling it.)
Also makes it so Nidalee couldn't just spear from behind turret and share gold. &c. &c.
